answers.answer_1: Node.js is an open source server environment. Node.js allows you to run JavaScript on the server.
answers.answer_2: It is a used as backend service where javascript works on the server-side of the application. This way javascript is used on both frontend and backend. Node.js runs on chrome v8 engine which converts javascript code into machine code, it is highly scalable, lightweight, fast, and data-intensive.

answers.answer_1: Cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) is a mechanism that allows restricted resources on a web page to be requested from another domain outside the domain from which the first resource was served.

questions.question_2: What other options do you have to implement authentication?

answers.answer_1: Firebase helps you develop high-quality apps, grow your user base, and earn more money. Each feature works independently, and they work even better together.
answers.answer_2: It supports authentication using passwords, phone numbers, popular federated identity providers like Google, Facebook and Twitter, and more.

answers.answer_1: PrivateRoute component is the blueprint for all private routes in the application. If the user is logged in, go on and display the component in question; otherwise, redirect the user to sign-in page. Additionally, we can define the logic of isLogin utility function separately in utils folder.
